title: SME renews excepted GLA and reviews PHI definitions
vignette: Bravo Plc operates an excepted GLA plan for senior staff and a PHI plan using an 'own occupation' definition for the first 2 years, then 'any suited'. The scheme has grown rapidly and is under pressure to control unit rates at renewal.

questions.stem: Which is a key RISK specific to excepted GLA compared with registered schemes?
options: Benefits are ALWAYS taxed as income
Potential for a charge if conditions for excepted status are breached
Members must pay the premiums personally
questions.explanation: Excepted GLA has specific HMRC requirements; breaching them can trigger a tax charge.

questions.stem: For PHI, tightening the definition from 'own occupation' to 'any occupation' MOST likely:
options: Is not permitted in group policies
questions.explanation: Stricter definitions generally reduce claim likelihood and lower premiums.

questions.stem: From a broker/intermediary perspective at renewal, the MOST appropriate action is:
options: Only present last year's rate; avoid alternative quotes
Market test the case; review claims experience, eligibility, and benefit design
Remove the master trust to simplify
questions.explanation: An intermediary should test the market and review drivers (claims, eligibility, design).
